title: Beloved
description: A haunting novel about the legacy of slavery and a mother’s fierce love.
author: Toni Morrison

title: The Kite Runner
description: A story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's turmoil.
author: Khaled Hosseini

title: American Gods
description: A blend of mythology and Americana where gods walk among mortals in a modern war of faith.
author: Neil Gaiman

title: The Secret History
description: A dark academic thriller about a group of classics students at an elite college and a murder that binds them.
author: Donna Tartt

title: Never Let Me Go
description: A dystopian reflection on identity, love, and the meaning of life in a world of human cloning.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro

title: The Night Circus
description: A magical competition between two illusionists unfolds in a mysterious, dreamlike circus.
author: Erin Morgenstern

title: The Handmaid's Tale
description: A chilling dystopia where women are reduced to reproductive roles in a theocratic regime.
author: Margaret Atwood

title: A Man Called Ove
description: A grumpy yet loveable old man finds his life changed by unexpected friendships.
author: Fredrik Backman

title: The Goldfinch
description: A boy’s life is shaped by a tragedy and a stolen painting in this epic literary novel.
author: Donna Tartt

title: Shantaram
description: A fugitive’s journey through the underworld of Bombay in this gripping, semi-autobiographical novel.
author: Gregory David Roberts

description: A dystopian novel exploring the dangers of totalitarianism and extreme political ideology.
author: George Orwell

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A story of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.
author: Harper Lee

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A disenchanted teenager narrates his journey through New York City.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel centered on manners, upbringing, and moral rightness.
author: Jane Austen

title: Frankenstein
description: A scientist’s creation of life leads to tragic consequences in this gothic classic.
author: Mary Shelley

title: Dracula
description: The legendary vampire tale that introduced Count Dracula to literature.
author: Bram Stoker

title: Brave New World
description: A futuristic society engineered for stability clashes with individual freedom and emotion.
author: Aldous Huxley

title: Fahrenheit 451
description: In a future where books are banned, a fireman questions his role in a society without knowledge.
author: Ray Bradbury

title: Life of Pi
description: A boy survives a shipwreck and shares a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.
author: Yann Martel

title: The Alchemist
description: A young shepherd journeys to discover a treasure and fulfill his personal legend.
author: Paulo Coelho

title: The Book Thief
description: A young girl in Nazi Germany finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others.
author: Markus Zusak

title: The Road
description: A post-apocalyptic tale of a father and son journeying through a devastated landscape.
author: Cormac McCarthy

title: The Shadow of the Wind
description: A boy in post-war Barcelona discovers a mysterious book that draws him into a literary mystery.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

title: The Name of the Wind
description: A gifted young man tells the story of his life, from orphan to legendary wizard.
author: Patrick Rothfuss

title: Siddhartha
description: A philosophical novel about the spiritual journey of self-discovery by a man in ancient India.
author: Hermann Hesse

title: Moby-Dick
description: Captain Ahab obsessively hunts the great white whale, Moby Dick, in this epic sea tale.
author: Herman Melville

title: Crime and Punishment
description: A psychological novel exploring the mind of a murderer and the consequences of his actions.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

title: Jane Eyre
description: An orphaned girl becomes a governess and falls in love with her mysterious employer.
author: Charlotte Brontë

title: The Hobbit
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on a quest to help dwarves reclaim their homeland from a dragon.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A man remains eternally young while a hidden portrait reflects his moral decay.
author: Oscar Wilde

title: The Outsiders
description: A story about the rivalry between two gangs, the Greasers and the Socs, in 1960s Oklahoma.
author: S.E. Hinton

title: The Hunger Games
description: In a dystopian future, a young girl must fight in a televised death match to survive.
author: Suzanne Collins

title: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream in the Roaring Twenties.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
description: The first book in the epic fantasy series about a group of heroes who seek to destroy an evil ring.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: A young boy discovers he's a wizard and begins his first year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
author: J.K. Rowling

title: The Girl on the Train
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who becomes involved in a missing person case.
author: Paula Hawkins

title: The Silent Patient
description: A psychotherapist attempts to uncover why a woman shot her husband and stopped speaking.
author: Alex Michaelides

title: The Night Circus
description: Two young illusionists engage in a magical duel inside a mysterious circus.
author: Erin Morgenstern

title: The Martian
description: A stranded astronaut must survive on Mars using his ingenuity and determination.
author: Andy Weir

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
description: A woman growing up in the swamps of North Carolina becomes a suspect in a local murder case.
author: Delia Owens
